_header: O ye lovers that pleaden for your right
_description: Advice resented: a dialogue between an unhappy lover and the Advocate of Venus — fourteen stanzas rhyme royal

OxfCCC61.First Lines:
O ye lovers that pletyn for youre ryghtin venus courte as do so
                    moche for me…
OxfCCC61.Last Lines:
…turnyng with the wynd like to afaneffor my good cownsell yet
                    ye me blame
OxfCCC61.Note: Added by another hand to originally blank leaves at end.
OxfCCC61.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 169-72.
Bowers,  Robert Hood. 
             “Advice Resented: A Middle-English Court of Love Poem (Corpus Christi
                College MS 61, fol., 66v-67r).” 
             Philological Quarterly
         31 (1952): 211-14: 212-14.
